items.name: Trumpeting Blast (Swan Form Only) {@recharge 6}
entries: The golem emits a trumpeting blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 31 ({@damage 7d8}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

items.name: Weakened
entries: Any damage the golem deals to the PCs is halved.

items.name: Piano Wire
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: The mephit can innately cast {@spell grease}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

items.name: Summon Silverfish (1/Day)
entries: Panifex can use an action to summon a {@creature swarm of insects} (silverfish) to attack his foes.

items.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
Panifex cannot move beyond {@adventure Areas 8 and 9|ToB3-Lairs|6|8. Hidden Room} unless he has possessed a corporeal body.

items.name: Nimble Protector
entries: Fancy can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

entries: {@i Tome of Beasts 3 Lairs} contains 23 short-form adventures, that feature new creatures from the {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}. Each adventure is intended to take one or two sessions to complete and includes a map, adventure hooks, and treasures for your adventurers.

To run each of these adventures, you'll need the core rulebooks of the 5th edition of the world's first roleplaying game or the {@i System Reference Document 5.1}. Creatures whose names appear in {@b bold} without a page or book reference can be found in the {@i System Reference Document 5.1} or in those rulebooks. Similarly, spell and magic item names which appear in {@i italics} without a page or book reference can be found in those rulebooks or in the {@i System Reference Document 5.1}. In addition, you will need the {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json} to run the encounters in these adventures.
{@note Additional creature portraits and tokens can be found {@link here|https://github.com/TheGiddyLimit/homebrew/tree/master/_img/ToB3-Lairs/creature}.}
{@i Tome of Beasts 3 Lairs} includes the following adventures, listed by character level:

entries.name: Proudheart's Predator Problem
entries: Farmer Grumbo Proudheart has a problem. A mysterious entity has been eating his prized sheep, winners of the Halfling Wool-Off the past ten years. At his wit's end, he searches for heroes to uncover the culprit and save his farm.
This adventure features the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Flight of the Dromedaries
entries: A giant dragon soars overhead startling the camels of a caravan the heroes were hired to guard. The terrified beasts flee deep into a dangerous desert. Can the heroes survive the desert's dangers and round up the terrified mounts?
This adventure features the {@creature desert slime|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Furor in the Farmyard
entries: A notorious bandit and his crew have holed up at the Hundedel family farm following his daring escape from the local magistrate's cells. The criminals are holding the youngest Hundedel captive and have deceived the farm's dragonettes into helping them fortify and protect the farmhouse. Can the heroes free the young farm boy before he is harmed?

This adventure features the {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3}, {@creature shovel dragonette|ToB3}, and {@creature razorback crab|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Salvage at Lonely Cove
entries: A ship was sunk during a recent storm, and flotsam from the wreck has washed up in Lonely Cove, a hidden beach at the bottom of steep shoreline cliffs. Can the heroes collect the valuable salvage and survive the cove's inhabitants?

This adventure features the {@creature beach weird|ToB3}, {@creature guardian archaeopteryx|ToB3}, {@creature moon weaver|ToB3}, {@creature pescavitus|ToB3}, and {@creature talus flow|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Automated Banditry
entries: A group of bandits has stolen a small hoard of constructs, turning their new mechanical servants into a small army. The roads are no longer safe, and merchants are desperate for heroes who can end the bandits' reign.

This adventure features the {@creature atavist|ToB3}, {@creature animated instrument|ToB3|animated instruments}, {@creature clockwork armadillo|ToB3}, {@creature clockwork pugilist|ToB3}, and {@creature harvest horse|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Evil Rises
entries: The {@creature bakery drake|ToB3}, Amaranth, is the darling of the local nobility. Her baked goods are in high demand by the city's wealthy citizens, and it was a shock to all when she came under suspicion of poisoning several notable personages. Can the heroes brave the now-dangerous bakery, uncover the truth behind the poisoning, and bring justice to the drake?
This adventure features the {@creature bakery drake|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Four-Part Harmony
entries: Rumors of ghosts in the old haunted bardic college didn't stop the orphan Budanyek from breaking in. But now he's been gone for days, and his friends swear they hear terrifying sounds coming from the old college. Can a plucky group of heroes brave the tremulous terrors inside to find the missing Budanyek?

This adventure features the {@creature atavist|ToB3}, {@creature animated instrument|ToB3}, {@creature animated quartet|ToB3}, {@creature clockwork conductor|ToB3}, {@creature clockwork pugilist|ToB3}, and {@creature origami golem|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Harvest Fangs
entries: In the isolated farming village of Sycamore Crossing, this year's harvest is inexplicably failing. Faced with starvation, the villagers have fallen under the fell sway of a devious cult that promises a full harvest if the village regularly sacrifices people to the soil they till. The heroes must stop the cult and save the village before too many more travelers are abducted and sacrificed.
This adventure features the {@creature tripwire patch|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: The Pavilion of Whispers and Wonderment
entries: The Maestro, a fey with delusions of grandeur, operates out of a magnificent, extraplanar palace. An information hoarder, The Maestro collects uncomfortable secrets, scandals, and slander, using them to amass great power and wealth. The heroes must recover a particularly important secret kept by The Maestro, facing the odd inhabitants of the whimsical, dangerous pavilion along the way.

This adventure features the {@creature doppelixir|ToB3}, {@creature lobe lemur|ToB3}, {@creature hippopotamus|ToB3}, {@creature moppet|ToB3}, {@creature swarm of penguins|ToB3}, and {@creature veritigibbet|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Rainforest Reckoning
entries: Several weeks ago, villagers from the jungle village of Bukofa fell victim to mild, mischievous pranks while clearing trees for farmland. Now, events have taken a sinister turn and something lurks in the jungle, killing Bukofa's inhabitants. The village elder needs heroes to travel to the fey's grove and end the threat to the village.

This adventure features the {@creature aziza|ToB3}, {@creature giant walking stick|ToB3}, {@creature leavesrot ooze|ToB3}, {@creature monkey's bane vine|ToB3}, {@creature moon weaver|ToB3}, {@creature musk deer|ToB3}, {@creature rainforest ogre|ToB3}, and {@creature tripwire patch|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Safe and Sound
entries: An unusually large and ferocious cat has recently claimed the area outside of the town of Bay's Burrow as its territory. The area is bisected by a major trade route, and unfortunately the territorial beast has been disrupting caravans, killing horses, and generally making a nuisance of itself. Heroes are needed to kill the beast or encourage it to find a new home away from Bay's Burrow.
This adventure features the {@creature catamount|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Lord Gorgo's Keep
entries: Squatting atop a lonely peak surrounded by a dark wood, Spiteful Keep is the home of Lord Gorgo, a powerful ogre said to craft amazing magical items. Lord Gorgo's allies and servants fill the keep, discouraging trespassers and gathering materials for the artisan. Heroes willing to deal with the cunning ogre might be able to barter for magic items or take them by force, but the items might not be what they appear...

This adventure features the {@creature cunning artisan ogre|ToB3}, the {@creature daeodon|ToB3}, the {@creature dokkaebi|ToB3}, and the {@creature kobold ettin|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Redoubt of the Perfidious Guru
entries: There is a sanctuary hidden in the mountains where it is said one can learn the secrets of inner peace and perfection. The master of this secret place is said to be able to see into a person's very soul and divine their future from it, but something isn't quite right. Can the heroes uncover the truth and put an end to the fiendish machinations of the sanctuary's elusive leader?

This adventure features the {@creature alpine creeper|ToB3}, {@creature cloudhoof assassin|ToB3}, and {@creature lesser infernal tutor|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Incident at Wrackwater
entries: The fog-bound village of Wrackwater Cove thrives on the trade brought into its small harbor by the light of a lighthouse on a nearby spit of land. Recently, the beacon went out and the village's two search parties haven't returned. A ship with much-needed supplies is due any day, and the villagers seek heroes to find the missing patrols and light the beacon.

This adventure features the {@creature bilge gremlin|ToB3}, {@creature bilge gremlin bosun|ToB3}, {@creature giant flea|ToB3}, {@creature gullkin|ToB3}, {@creature gullkin hunter|ToB3}, and {@creature muraenid|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: The Lost Forge
entries: A dwarven fort high in the mountains was abandoned decades ago when a dragon's attack left much of it in ruins. The once-mighty forge stayed dormant for years, but now the forge blazes to life under the care of twin giants and their followers, who raid dwarven caravans carrying ore and ale. Locals turn to traveling heroes for help in dethroning the giants and bringing peace back to their area.

This adventure features the dwarf {@creature pike guard|ToB3}, dwarf {@creature pike guard captain|ToB3}, {@creature thursir armorer|ToB3} giant, {@creature thursir hearth priestess|ToB3} giant, and {@creature alleybasher ogre|ToB3|ogre alleybasher} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: The Monstrous Machinations of Margrave Millard
entries: The eccentric Margrave Millard has long considered himself a pioneer in magically created beasts, often parading his creations as short-lived show pets. However, he has recently begun creating more monstrous creatures and testing their murderous prowess on kidnapped citizens. Can the heroes stop the Margrave before he releases his creations to wreak havoc on the surrounding lands?

This adventure features the {@creature capybear|ToB3}, {@creature dire owlbear|ToB3}, {@creature grolar bear|ToB3}, {@creature grolar bear alpha|ToB3}, {@creature razorfeather raptor|ToB3}, and {@creature slithy tove|ToB3|slithy toves} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: The Green Sanctum
entries: An eccentric scholar spent her life studying exotic plants in an arboretum on a remote island. The scholar has since died and other scholars now want a particularly important plant she studied. Can the heroes survive the abandoned arboretum's deadly plants and convince its guardian to part with the exotic plant?
This adventure features the {@creature alpine creeper|ToB3}, {@creature ice willow|ToB3}, and {@creature ice golem|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: The Salons of Mother Celeste
entries: Days ago, the crew of a local fishing boat pulled up the remains of a sailor thought to belong to an overdue, missing merchant vessel. The nearby town's fishermen have since found the location of the wreck, and the local authorities put out a call for heroes willing to brave the water's depths and rescue what remains of the vessel's cargo.

This adventure features the {@creature bilge gremlin|ToB3}, {@creature bilge gremlin bosun|ToB3}, {@creature breakwater troll|ToB3}, {@creature brine hag|ToB3}, {@creature dire lionfish|ToB3}, and {@creature wrackwraith|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Chaos at the Caldera
entries: The town of Dorma sits on the fertile soil next to Mount Magra, a dormant volcano. Recently, portals have opened in the heart of the mountain, expelling violent creatures from other planes. Can the heroes vanquish these threats before the the volcano erupts and destroys the town?
This adventure features the {@creature ibexian|ToB3} and {@creature obsidian ophidian|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: The Eclipsed Chapel
entries: A painter named Pol seeks escort to an abandoned chapel. Convinced he's met an angel who wants him to paint a magic mural there in just one day, Pol's request may require a leap of faith. Is there a group of heroes who will stand vigil while Pol works his miracle?

This adventure features the {@creature apostle|ToB3}, {@creature copperkill slime|ToB3}, {@creature gearmass|ToB3}, {@creature leavesrot ooze|ToB3}, {@creature sinoper ooze|ToB3}, {@creature stained-glass moth|ToB3}, and {@creature gryllus swarm|ToB3|swarm of gryllus} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: The Twisted Sanctuary
entries: Down the street, among the shops and inns, sits the Veiled Mannequin, a tailor's shop for discerning customers. Unbeknownst to most, the tailor and her assistant guard the secret entrance to the Sanctuary of the Twisted Claw, a rakshasa safehouse hidden in the heart of the city. Can the heroes uncover the secret and stop the rakshasa before they cause irreparable damage to the city's denizens?

This adventure features the {@creature apostle|ToB3}, {@creature atavist|ToB3}, {@creature myrmidon rakshasa|ToB3|rakshasa myrmidon}, {@creature pustakam rakshasa|ToB3|rakshasa pustakam}, {@creature servitor rakshasa|ToB3|rakshasa servitor}, and {@creature slayer rakshasa|ToB3|rakshasa slayer} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: A Midnight Ride
entries: A strange, black horse draped in silver chains has been seen near a small farming village. The locals claim it is a fey creature that will run off with their sons and daughters. More concerning, however, is the group of cultists who recently arrived to capture the creature and use it to gain access to other planes. The farmers need heroes to chase off the cultists, and they promise a bonus if the heroes can do something about the fey as well.

This adventure features the {@creature leashed lesion|ToB3}, {@creature psychophant|ToB3} cultist, and {@creature púca|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

entries.name: Down in the Dark of The Deep King's Domain
entries: Down in the depths of the world, among twisting natural caverns where bioluminescent fungi shine as motes of light in the darkness, lies the lair of the Deep King. It hunts the world below, feeding on the spiritual essence of its victims and dragging their bodies back to its lair. Many have fallen in an attempt to put an end to this fell alien intelligence; can the heroes succeed where so many others have failed?
This adventure features the {@creature cave sovereign|ToB3} and {@creature duskwilt|ToB3} from {@loader Tome of Beasts 3|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts 3.json}.

rows: {@b An adventure for four to five characters of 1st level}

entries.name: Adventure Background
entries: Every year, halfling farmer Grumbo Proudheart enters his animals into the Halfling Wool-Off, a competition that attracts fellow farmers from throughout the region. The competition includes five categories: long wool, medium wool, fine wool, goat's wool, and lamb's wool. Grumbo has won the lamb's wool competition for the last three years. Recently, he's developed his goat breeding program and could now also win in that category.

The Wool-Off is in four days, and Grumbo is frantic, grooming his animals, sharpening his sheers, and loading his wagons. All was running smoothly until three nights ago when an unseen predator began menacing his flock.

Grumbo has had the bad luck of attracting the attention of a {@creature herd skulker|ToB3}, a dangerous and crafty wolflike predator that stalks herd animals, shapeshifting into one of their kind and hiding amongst them until it can get close enough to feast. It's been stalking the sheep, goats, chickens, and horses of Grumbo's farm, radiating an aura of calm that lulls the animals into a false sense of security.

At his wit's end, Grumbo seeks the help of the PCs in rooting out the menace and protecting his animals until the end of the week when he leaves for the Wool-Off. It would pain him greatly if harm came to any of his animals.

entries.name: Adventure Hook
entries: The following can entice the PCs into helping Grumbo:

items: {@b {@i Market Meeting.}} The PCs run into Grumbo as he's purchasing supplies at the local market. Seeing their weapons and armor, Grumbo begs them to come help him. He didn't want to leave his animals alone for the day, as only his dogs remain to protect them, but he had little choice.

{@b {@i Fair Competition.}} Lucy Porridge, a rival competitor in the Wool-Off (and Grumbo's cousin), heard about Grumbo's troubles. She wants to win the Wool-Off fairly and that's only possible if Grumbo brings his best. Lucy runs into the PCs on the road and explains the situation, offering the same reward as explained below.

entries: Whichever hook you choose, if the PCs ask for reward, they are offered 50 gp if they can rid the farm of whatever is hunting Grumbo's animals, plus another 50 if they keep all of his animals alive and uninjured in the process.

entries.name: Grumbo and His Farm

entries: Grumbo's farm occupies an acre of land, situated amid rolling pastures, fields, and trees. Every building, plot, and pen is pristine, recently painted and meticulously maintained. Carefully tended flower boxes adorn the farmstead with sunflowers, tulips, and daisies. Grumbo beams as he admires his farm, but then his eyes fill with tears as he looks at the baby sheep and goats playing in their pens. He pulls out a handkerchief, wiping his eyes. "Please, you're my only hope. It would kill me if that monster ate my animals. I couldn't bear it."

Grumbo Proudheart (LG halfling {@creature commoner}) is a perpetually nervous halfling in his early 40s with thinning gray hair and sideburns, a substantial belly, a strong musculature from decades of farm labor, and a quick laugh. His pride and joy are his sheep and goats, and he frets constantly about their safety. He is a lifelong bachelor, and he sent all of his farmhands away shortly before the PCs arrived for fear of the creature harming them. He is alone now, except for his dogs and livestock.

entries.name: The Predator
entries: The creature plaguing Grumbo's farm is a {@creature herd skulker|ToB3}.

entries.name: The Farmstead
entries: Grumbo's vast farmstead is comprised of animal pens, a barn, a chicken coop, a vegetable garden, his home, and his pasture. Grumbo gives the PCs a tour and grants them complete access to all the buildings and lands, including his cottage. (See Areas {@area 1|1.1|x}–{@area 6|1.6|x} for more information.)

entries.name: Grumbo's Prize Animals
entries: Grumbo cares deeply for all of his flock, but he has four prized animals he loves more than life itself. He has three baby sheep (lambs): Lady Lanolyn of Lambshire, Duke Fuzzington von Felt, and Prince Lambert, plus a baby goat (kid) named Sir Cashimir of the Order of the Fleece.

entries.name: Grumbo's Dogs
entries: Grumbo has an eager, vigilant wolfhound named Fancy. She's massive, easily triple Grumbo's own weight. She could scare off any normal predator, but the herd skulker is far from normal. If the PCs get into in trouble while fighting the creature, Fancy comes to their aid.
{@creature Fancy|ToB3-Lairs} uses the statistics of a {@creature wolf}, but replace Pack Tactics with the following feature:

entries.name: Nimble Protector
entries: Fancy can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of her turns.
Grumbo also has a trio of sheepdogs—Lucy, Dart, and Priscilla—that herd his sheep and goats. Grumbo has been keeping them in the house or by his side for their safety.

entries.name: Overnight Accommodations
entries: Grumbo doesn't have any extra beds available, but he welcomes the PCs to stay with him, allowing them to sleep on the floor, using the many pillows and rugs scattered about his living space.

If they prefer, they are welcome to stay in Grumbo's barn instead; if so, he puts down fresh hay in the many empty stalls, though the barn was essentially immaculate already. The PCs will have to share the barn with a cow, two draft horses, and a pony. (See {@area 4|1.4|u}.)
Wherever the PCs decide to spend the night, whenever Grumbo cooks a meal for himself (which is early and often), he brings some for each of the PCs as they stand guard.

entries.name: What Grumbo Knows
entries: If the PCs question Grumbo about the creature and/or its predations, he'll gladly share anything he knows:

items: All of Grumbo's preparations for the Wool-Off were running smoothly until three nights ago when something began stalking one of his prized lambs, Duke Fuzzington.
Fancy scared it off before he could get a look at it.
Grumbo searched the farm afterward and even hired some locals to investigate, but they found nothing.

Last night, the creature made a play for another lamb, Prince Lambert. Grumbo heard a strange sound outside his window and rushed to investigate. The creature had cornered Lambert and was about to pounce when Grumbo blew a bullhorn, startling it, and the creature fled.
This time, Grumbo caught sight of it, but he couldn't believe his eyes; it looked just like his other lambs, but its movements were aggressive and not-at-all lamblike.
Grumbo doesn't know if the creature is a threat during the day or not, but both incidents happened at night.
Despite the threat of the creature, Grumbo has no choice but to continue opening the gate each morning because the animals need to eat. He refuses any suggestion that he do otherwise.

entries.name: Grumbo's Menagerie
entries: Since this adventure has the PCs protecting a flock from a predator, they might wish to know how many animals Grumbo has in total. For ease of reference, his total number of animals is included here, with any names of particularly prized animals in parentheses:

items: Chickens: 9 (Penelope)
Roosters: 1 (Cody)
Goats: 30 (Sir Cashimir of the Order of the Fleece [a prized kid])
Sheep: 45 (Lady Lanolyn of Lambshire, Duke Fuzzington von Felt, and Prince Lambert [all prized lambs])
Cows: 1 (Pinkle)
Horses: 2 (Binny and Winny)
Ponies: 1 (Theodora)
Sheepdogs: 3 (Lucy, Dart, and Priscilla)
Wolfhounds: 1 ({@creature Fancy|ToB3-Lairs})

entries: The totals above include all of the prized animals and any babies (i.e., lambs or kids).

entries.name: Avoiding Cruelty to Animals
entries: This adventure depicts a very real struggle facing farmers—predators hunting their livestock. While it's important to get the PCs to feel for Grumbo, the goal is never to graphically describe the death of animals. Give the PCs hints and chances to catch the herd skulker in the act before it harms the animals. If the PCs make a mistake or fail crucial checks, give them the opportunity to confront the herd skulker and scare it off rather than having it simply murder an animal. If that fails and the herd skulker captures or kills an animal, leave details to a minimum, so as to avoid distressing players. Perhaps the PCs find a bit of wool, a feather, or a single drop of blood. Check with your players about their comfort level with this and adjust accordingly.

This advice also applies to {@creature Fancy|ToB3-Lairs} and the three sheepdogs, Lucy, Dart, and Priscilla. They can help the PCs if they are struggling, but it is strongly advised that you avoid allowing the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} to harm them. For his part, Grumbo refuses to send the sheepdogs into danger; if there's a threat, he sends {@creature Fancy|ToB3-Lairs}, but her Nimble Protector feature should allow her to help but avoid harm. In any case, the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} does not go after her or the sheepdogs, focusing instead on the PCs or escape.

The {@creature herd skulker|ToB3|herd skulker's} natural form bears similarities to that of wolves, but it should not be depicted as anything but the horrible monster that it is. If harming a creature that resembles a real animal would distress your players, modify the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3|herd skulker's} true form to something altogether alien.
{@note An unlabelled version of the map can be found {@link here|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TheGiddyLimit/homebrew/master/_img/ToB3-Lairs/map/1.jpg}.}

entries.name: 1. Sheep Pen

entries: A short, wooden fence surrounds a large sheep pen that occupies the northwest quarter of Grumbo's farmstead. Lazing within are thirty sheep, though others wander in and out of the open twenty-foot-wide gate on the western side. More sheep graze in the pastures surrounding the farmstead. Several fuzzy lambs chase each other enthusiastically, the older sheep observing disinterestedly. One of the lambs approaches the fence and baas at you in greeting.

Grumbo keeps the gate open during the day and closes it at night, though a determined predator can easily leap the low fence. The sheep, too, will leap the fence at the first sign of a predator, which may necessitate the PCs locating them. The lamb that greets the PCs is Lady Lanolyn of Lambshire.

entries.name: 2. Goat Pen

entries: A large goat pen surrounded by a low, wooden fence occupies the northeast quarter of the farmstead. Milling about inside are twenty goats, and you can see more goats grazing in the pasture beyond the pen as well. The wide gate on the eastern side of the fence is open, allowing the goats the freedom to go in or out. Several downy kids gambol about within and are occasionally joined by the older goats. One baby goat approaches the fence when you near, sticking his nose out for a scritch or a treat.

Like the sheep pen, Grumbo keeps the gate open during the day and closes it at night. A determined predator, such as the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3}, can leap the easily low fence, as can all but the smallest of the goats. The kid seeking scritches is Sir Cashimir of the Order of the Fleece.

entries.name: 3. Grumbo's House

entries: Grumbo's small house is located in the southwestern portion of the farmstead. He welcomes you inside, insisting on providing tea and cookies for all. The interior of the cottage is immaculate and homey. Overstuffed pillows and plush rugs cover the floor, a comfy bed occupies the northwest corner, a table for six sits in the center, and a wood-burning stove graces the southeast corner. Custom cabinets and closets are built into the walls. Three merry sheepdogs lie in a tangle on a fluffy dog bed near the stove.
Grumbo painstakingly built this home. The door doesn't have a lock, as Grumbo has little fear of intruders. Even if the door is left wide open, the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} does not enter.

entries.name: 4. Barn

entries: Grumbo leads you to a neatly painted red barn and opens the doors. Most of the stalls are empty, save for the four nearest the door, which contain a cow, two draft horses, and a pony. Grumbo points to the cow. "Pinkle here is a good cow. She's very patient." He waves his hand in the direction of the horses. "Binny and Winny are a tad lazy, but they do their jobs." Finally, he stops at the stall of the pony, who noses his hand, and hands her a carrot. "Theodora is the best pony that ever lived. I'm riding her to the fair."
Like everything else on Grumbo's property, the barn's been kept immaculate.

Grumbo points out a substantial chicken coop east of the barn. "Happy chickens lay tasty eggs. That what I always say." He waves at a hen squawking at several others. "Penelope keeps the other hens in line." He nods at the lone rooster. "Cody mostly keeps to himself, though a couple of the hens like him quite a bit."

entries.name: 6. Vegetable Garden

entries: A large vegetable garden lines the southern edge of the farmstead, featuring neat rows of cucumbers, radishes, tomatoes, onions, zucchini, and turnips.
Grumbo loves gardening almost as much as raising animals. He doesn't need to say so; this bounteous garden and the numerous flower boxes scattered around the property make that clear.

entries.name: Catching the Herd Skulker
entries: Each night the PCs stay at Grumbo's farm, they have a chance to catch the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} in the act, but it's a clever and cautious foe with an uncanny ability to disappear within herds, so it will be difficult. Though the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} possesses a dangerous bite, it's a coward and runs if it feels threatened.

entries.name: Guard Duty
entries: Any PCs on guard duty must succeed on a DC 16 check using one of the following skills: Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}) or Intelligence ({@skill Nature}).

entries.name: Success
entries: On a success, the PCs notice the creature entering the chicken coop and arrive in time to stop it before it attacks. The {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} flees (using its Spring Attack ability to avoid {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}) when the PCs arrive and attempts to hide amongst one of the other groups of animals. If a PC blocks the entrance to the chicken coop, the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} leaps at them, attempting to shove them out of the way so it can escape.

entries.name: Failure
entries: On a failure, the PCs hear a commotion of squawking chickens. When they arrive at the coop, the chickens are running around wildly, screeching, the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} hidden among them. If the PCs hesitated for more than a round before rushing to investigate, the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} assumes its true form, eats one of the chickens, then shifts back into a chicken before they arrive.

entries.name: Creature Considerations
entries: The animals are all on edge, as if they can sense the danger in the air.

entries.name: Animal Handlers
entries: PCs proficient in {@skill Animal Handling} have a well-honed sense of animal behavior. They can observe the animals and succeed on a Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check contested by the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3|herd skulker's} Charisma ({@skill Deception}) to notice that one of them is behaving suspiciously.

entries.name: Answers from Animals
entries: If the animals are questioned using magic, they communicate that there's a new animal in the pen that doesn't smell right. If the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} is still present, the animals can direct the PCs to it. Being not terribly intelligent, they have little useful information, but if the PCs spend too long trying to talk with them they might allow the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} to slip away.

entries.name: Running the Herd Skulker
entries: The {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} is a cunning, vicious predator that behaves cautiously and attacks only when advantageous.

entries.name: Monstrosity Not Beast
entries: It is important to remember that the herd skulker is a monstrosity, not a beast—even though it much of the time looks and acts like a beast. Accordingly, spells that only affect beasts will not work on the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3}. For instance, if the PCs use {@spell speak with animals} to attempt to talk to the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} (regardless of what form it is in), it doesn't respond; a successful DC 12 Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) or Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling} or {@skill Survival}) check determines that the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} doesn't understand the words being spoken, despite the spell.

entries.name: Patient Pounce
entries: The {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} waits for the PCs to relax before it risks attacking one of the goats or sheep. If the PCs remain vigilant, it spends the rest of the evening among the animals, then attempts to slip away when Grumbo opens the gate for the goats to graze at dawn, wandering off to sleep until nightfall. Vigilant PCs can attempt a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check opposed by the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3|herd skulker's} {@skill Stealth}; on a success, the PCs can spot the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} attempting to slink away.

entries.name: True Form Revealed
entries: If the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} reveals itself to any of Grumbo's animals, each PC may attempt a DC 13 check to hear them crying or otherwise sense the disturbance, using one of the following skills: Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}) or Intelligence ({@skill Nature}).

On a success, if the PCs immediately rush to investigate, they catch the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} before it attacks. It fights if pressed, but, if it's reduced below half its hit points, it flees.

On a failure, the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} heads back to the farm to hide, either in the stables or in the sheep or goat pen, where Grumbo's animals still remain. If any of Grumbo's animals are presently immune to the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3|herd skulker's} Herd-Hidden ability, it avoids those specific enclosures until said immunity has expired.

entries.name: The Cost of Delay
entries: If the PCs detect the animals' distress but delay rushing to their aid for a round, they arrive at the scene to discover frantic sheep and goats running about the pasture. At the edge of the goat pen, they find one dazed-looking goat with wet, mussed fur on the back of its neck, but otherwise unharmed; the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} abandoned this goat when the PCs approached and hid somewhere nearby.
If the PCs delay longer than one round, the {@skill herd skulker|ToB3} kills one of the goats and carries it off. They find a few bits of goat fuzz and signs of a struggle in the dirt.

entries.name: Escape
entries: If the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} escapes and the PCs track it, they can follow the trail of the creature into the pasture and confront it there.

entries.name: Prey Play
entries: The {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} continues to play these games with the animals and PCs for the up to three nights; after the third night, if the PCs do not drive it off or kill it, the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} will wander off in search of easier prey.

entries.name: Concluding the Adventure
entries: The adventure concludes when the PCs either kill the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} or defend (or attempt to defend) the animals for three nights.

If the PCs protect all the animals for three nights and kill (or drive off) the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3}, Grumbo is eternally grateful and happily pays the PCs the full promised reward. The following day, he leaves for the Wool-Off both relieved and exhausted.

If the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} kills any of Grumbo's animals—but none of his four prized babies (Fuzzington, Lanolyn, Lambert, and Cashimir)—Grumbo will give the PCs the initial 50 gp reward and will still pay the 50 gp bonus if a PC succeeds on a DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check or if there is a fellow halfling in the party who is kind (or at least not unkind) to Grumbo. Grumbo sadly continues his plans to attend the Wool-Off, but it's clear that a substantial amount of wind has been taken out of his sails.

If the PCs dispatch the {@creature herd skulker|ToB3} after it has killed any of Grumbo's prize animals, he grudgingly gives them the 50 gp reward but refuses to pay any more than that. He is absolutely despondent, as if he had lost a member of his own family and is not shy about expressing his extreme disappointment in the PCs' failure to follow through on their promise to protect his flock. Grumbo cancels his plans to attend the Wool-Off this year, too overcome with grief to make the journey.

rows: {@b An adventure for four to five characters of 2nd level}

entries.name: Adventure Background
entries: Tasnim Azul (LN dwarf {@creature veteran}), a tall, eagle-eyed woman with braided black hair, is looking to hire capable guards to defend the caravan she is leading across the desert to the city of Onist.

entries.name: Adventure Hook
entries: The PCs encounter the caravan on the road while traveling to a new locale, or perhaps they run into Tasnim in the market square of a city, where she recognizes their kind (i.e., people who look like they can handle themselves in a fight) and inquires about engaging their services.

entries.name: Getting Hired
entries: Tasnim pays well for caravan guards skilled in steel and spell—but she demands the best. She offers the PCs 300 gp each in exchange for their services protecting the caravan along its journey to the city of Onist. The PCs must defend the caravan from bandits, protect the cargo, and keep the ten camels from escaping. Any failure to deliver all of the promised cargo to the city of Onist results in significant financial and reputational loss for her. When offered the job, it is made abundantly clear to the PCs that her losses come out of their own pay if she finds them to be at fault. Tasnim expects the journey will take approximately two months.
The caravan is transporting one or two items of valuable cargo. Choose from the list below, or choose your own:

items: Fresh limes bound for a seawater port;
Fragrant citrons for manufacturing fine perfumes;
Whole coffee beans for sale in faraway souks;
Ornate jewelry inlayed with precious gems, coveted by concubine and courtesan alike;
Finely crafted steel helmets promised to the commander of heavy infantry.

entries.name: Dragon Sighting
entries: Shortly after the caravan begins its early morning trek, an {@creature adult blue dragon} soars low overhead. While the dragon is oblivious to the humanoids below, it's flying low enough that everyone in the caravan must make a saving throw against its Frightful Presence.

While the PCs deal with their own fears, a number of the caravan's camels equal to the number of PCs break their bindings and bound down the desert trail. Due to their movement speed (50 feet), the camels likely leave any pursuing PCs in the literal dust.

Tasnim is quick to remind the PCs that they were in charge of securing the camels. If the PCs don't recover the camels (50 gp each) and the cargo they carried (worth a total of 50 gp × the number of PCs), those losses come out of their pay.

Luckily, the camels leave a trail in the sands—the expensive cargo that falls from their saddlebags. A successful DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check allows a PC to track the camels to a sandy valley while it's still midmorning. On a failure, the PCs arrive at the sandy valley after the sun reaches high in the midday sky.

entries.name: The Sandy Valley
entries: Before their fear waned, the escaped camels fled down the desert trail and into a small valley surrounded by steep escarpments. This out-of-the-way valley houses the ruins of an ancient shrine to a forgotten god, as well as a primordial pool of rock and minerals that guards the valley.
{@note An unlabelled version of the map can be found {@link here|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TheGiddyLimit/homebrew/master/_img/ToB3-Lairs/map/2.jpg}.}

entries.name: 1. Valley Entrance

entries: The camel tracks lead off the beaten path and into a small valley. Steep escarpments shoot up at sharp angles, rising to the flat butte that meets the skyline.
The eastern butte blocks the rising sun from beating down on the sands—even if the PCs arrived midday.

If the PCs brought the caravan in their pursuit, there is adequate space for the remaining camels to graze while the PCs locate the lost dromedaries. Tasnim and her other workers focus on caring for—and keeping a close eye on—the camels that didn't escape, and so they are not in a position to help the PCs recover those that fled.

entries.name: 2. The Oasis

entries: Toward the northern end of the valley entrance, another small caravan is resting by a small oasis. Their camels block access to the fresh water.
The PCs can approach members of the other caravan and inquire if anyone saw the fleeing camels.

entries.name: Friendly Approach
entries: If the PCs don't appear threatening, the caravan workers explain they saw the fleeing camels gallop into the sandy valley and up the narrow incline no less than 15 minutes ago. If asked, they have no knowledge of a blue dragon flying through this area recently.

entries.name: Unfriendly Approach
entries: If the PCs appear threatening, the caravan workers try to avoid the dangerous adventurers. The PCs can put the caravan workers at ease with a successful DC 13 Charisma ({@skill Deception} or {@skill Persuasion}) check, thereby convincing them to reveal the information about the fleeing camels.

entries.name: Notable Travelers
entries: In addition to the caravan workers, two notables lounge at the oasis. The PCs may speak with them before the other caravan resumes its journey.

Tadalesh Tesfay (NG human {@creature noble}) is a wealthy gambler from a distant nation. He is traveling to Onist and needs bodyguards for once he arrives in the city. After noticing the PCs' weapons and capable nature, he asks them to meet him at the Azure Flame Gambling House. Once they arrive, Tadalesh asks them to help him pull one last heist—recovering treasured artifacts first stolen from his people.

Zehava Rasason (N high elf {@creature mage}) is a transmuter traveling to Onist, where she'll teach at the wizarding college. Before she can begin classes, she must clear thugs from the transmutation tower. She is considering hiring adventurers to deal with this nuisance below her station.

entries.name: The Pool
entries: While there's no space for Tasnim's camels to drink from the pool, the PCs can squeeze between the animals to take sips from the pool or even fill canteens with fresh water.

Any creature that drinks from the pool has advantage on Constitution saving throws against the heat for 1 hour; any water taken from the oasis loses this beneficial property 1 hour after its removal from the pool.
Just past the oasis, the path narrows, as if some primordial giant had tried to pinch shut the valley eons ago. The slope rises at a steady incline, leading to the northern half of the sandy valley.

entries.name: Pit Trap
entries: As the camels rushed through this area, they greatly disturbed the sand, which had long rested precariously above an underground pit. PCs who are actively searching for traps or hazards identify the danger with a successful DC 13 Wisdom ({@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival}) check. Any PC who succeeds on a DC 10 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check can carefully skirt around the edge of the narrow incline, thereby avoiding triggering the hazard.

If the PCs don't notice the hazard (or fail to avoid it), the sand beneath their feet gives way. As the sand collapses, the PCs fall into an underground pit that is 15 feet in diameter and 15 feet deep. Fortunately, the sand below cushions the PCs' fall, and they suffer no falling damage.

entries.name: The Western Wind
entries: Though the PCs survive the fall without difficulty, the cursed western wind suddenly whips up, and the pit begins filling with sand. The pit fills in 1 minute, burying any PCs still inside after 10 rounds.

entries.name: Escaping the Pit
entries: To climb out of the pit, each PC must succeed on three DC 13 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks; using ropes or other climbing gear grants advantage on the rolls. If the {@dice d20} roll is a natural 20, it counts as two successes; if the {@dice d20} roll is a natural 1, the PC falls to the bottom of the pit, losing any accrued successes.
The PCs shouldn't tarry, as the pit quickly fills with sand. After five rounds, the PCs have disadvantage on all ability checks they make while in the pit.

Everyone in Tasnim's caravan is too far away to reach the PCs before the pit is filled. If the PCs find themselves in desperate straits, one of the notable travelers from {@area 2|2.2|u} is close enough to help, arriving with rope at the end of the third turn. (They refuse to proceed any further into the valley—the pit is already risky enough.)

entries.name: Buried PCs
entries: PCs buried in the pit are {@condition restrained} and unable to speak. The number of successes determines the level at which the PCs are buried:

items: 2 successes: 5 feet
1 success: 10 feet
No successes: 15 feet

entries: Buried PCs are likewise {@quickref suffocating||2}. It may be helpful for you to reference those rules and calculate how long each PC can hold their breath before this event begins.

entries.name: Rescuing Trapped PCs
entries: If PCs not trapped in the pit have appropriate equipment, such as a shovel, they can dig out their buried companions. It takes 1 minute to dig down 5 feet in the loose sand. Once a PC reaches the depth of a buried companion, that PC can breathe and stops {@quickref suffocating||2}.

entries.name: Development
entries: After 1 minute, the sand completely fills the pit, and the PCs can walk over it without issue. If the PCs avoided triggering the trap while traveling up the narrow incline, they cannot avoid the trap when returning with the camels. Camels falling into the pit are buried in the sand after 1 minute, perishing soon thereafter.

entries.name: 4. The Eastern Dunes

entries: To the east of the incline, flat sands stretch to the edge of the valley. Drought-resistant trees line the edge of these dunes, while the late morning sun glitters from the arid ground.
If the PCs arrive in the morning, the eastern escarpments block the sun from shining down on the dunes.

entries.name: Hot Sands
entries: At midday, the dunes are fiery hot, forcing the PCs each to make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw when they begin traveling through this area; on a failure, they take {@damage 1d4} fire damage as the hot sands burn their feet. (Barefoot creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw.) This is intended to be a one-time effect, but if the PCs linger in the area you might require them to succeed on the saving throw again or suffer additional damage.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: A PC who succeeds on a DC 12 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check notices five {@creature vulture||vultures} fly into the sky at the PCs' approach. If the PCs follow the birds' flight path, they witness the vultures meet up with a {@creature giant vulture}. These scavengers view the PCs as potential meals and swoop down to attack the PCs if they proceed further into this area.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The vultures exploit their Pack Tactics feature, splitting into two groups of three. They target anyone who looks weaker or who has lagged behind the group.

entries.name: Development
entries: The {@creature giant vulture} disengages from combat and flees to its roost if it starts its turn with less than 8 hit points. The other {@creature vulture||vultures} attempt to fly away if the {@creature giant vulture} dies or has disengaged, or if at the start of their turn there are two or fewer other {@creature vulture||vultures} remaining.

entries.name: 5. The Bushes

entries: Thick bushes line a tapered sliver of the sandy valley. A number of broken branches are scattered about the sand near the bushes, and some half-broken boughs still cling to their branches.
If the PCs arrive in the morning, there is a faint odor in the air that they can't quite place. If the PCs arrive midday, the unmistakable smell of a rotting corpse fill their nostrils.

entries.name: In the Bushes
entries: If the PCs inspect the bushes, they locate the bloated corpse of a slender, redheaded halfling. A successful DC 13 Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check deduces that the halfling was trying to climb the steep escarpment when she fell to her death.

entries.name: Gear
entries: A PC who spends 10 minutes searching the area and succeeds on a DC 10 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check finds the components of a {@item climber's kit|PHB} near the steep escarpment.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: On the body is an ornate, ruby-crusted {@item dagger|phb} (worth 10 gp); the shards from two shattered {@item potion of healing||potions of healing}; and a fine wooden case containing 5 engraved rings (worth 20 gp). A PC who succeeds on a DC 17 Intelligence ({@skill History}) check recognizes the engravings of the ruling family of Onist—and that the ruling family are not halfling.

entries.name: 6. The Gnoll God's Temple

entries: Aging, cream-colored pillars rise from a marble foundation, covered with ancient crimson stains. Underneath the crumbling canopy sits the gigantic, crumbling effigy of a gnoll god, clad in armor and wielding a vicious glaive.

Long ago, this temple served as the center of worship for the gnolls in this region. Great packs would gather before this giant idol, offering praise and sacrifices to their progenitor god before embarking on great marauding campaigns across the realm.

A PC who succeeds on a DC 17 Intelligence ({@skill History}) check recalls that, ages ago, desert druids drove the gnolls out of the sandy valley. These druids left some kind of hidden guardians to protect the valley from gnolls and any other interlopers (see {@area 8|2.8|u}).
Time has not been kind to the temple. Over time, the sand has chipped away at the pillars and robbers have stripped the valuables from the once ornate statue—all save for the gnoll god's right eye.

entries.name: The Gnoll God's Eye
entries: The gnoll god statue stands 20 feet tall. A PC who wishes to remove the eye gem can do so with 5 minutes of careful work with a {@item dagger|phb} or similar implement; time has worn away most of what held the stone in place so it doesn't require much skill to remove it. Climbing the statue requires two successful DC 13 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks; any creature wearing medium or heavy armor makes this check with disadvantage.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The gnoll god's eye is a crimson almandine garnet the size of a large grapefruit; most buyers would gladly pay 100 gp for it, but, if the PCs find a buyer interested in gnoll culture or religion, they could sell the gem for as much as 500 gp.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: If the PCs remove the eye, they disturb a {@creature swarm of wasps}, which attacks anyone holding the eye. Development. While the temple is potentially a good place to rest, resting there allows the sun to rise higher in the midday sky. Additionally, if the PCs linger, their presence draws the {@creature desert slime|ToB3|desert slimes} to attack at the temple (see {@area 8|2.8|u}).

entries.name: 7. The Western Dunes

entries: Camel prints head off along the western dunes, heat gleaming off the sand.

The harsh sun already sits high enough in the sky that it has already been beating down on the western dunes for several hours. From this vantage point, the PCs can see the camels resting in {@area 8|2.8|u}.

entries.name: Hot Sands
entries: PCs who arrived in the late morning must make DC 10 Constitution saving throws the first time they cross this area. On a failure, the PCs' movement speed is reduced by 10 feet. PCs who fail by 5 or more also suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
The desert sun is even hotter for PCs who arrive midday; this increases the Constitution saving throw DC to 15.
PCs who drank water from the oasis have advantage on this saving throw. If they brought water from the oasis, you may suggest they feel the urge to take a sip at this time.

entries.name: 8. The Primordial Pool

entries: At the northern edge of the western dunes, the camels rest, tired from their escape. Beyond the dromedaries, a bubble of gas rises up from a pit of slightly undulating sand.

The steep escarpments cast a shadow over this area. Desert druids created this primordial pool of silt, fine rock, and minerals to birth their desert slime guardians to keep the gnolls from returning to the sandy valley.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Two {@creature desert slime|ToB3|desert slimes} emerge from the primordial pool, startling the camels and sending the beasts running.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The first {@creature desert slime|ToB3} pursues the PCs. The other slime chases after the camels, but struggles to catch the beasts even at a slow trot. Once the PCs defeat the first slime, the second slime stops chasing the camels and targets the PCs instead.

entries.name: Dangerous Foe
entries: Having the PCs fight both slimes at the same would be extremely challenging for PCs of this level and could easily end with the death of multiple PCs.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: PCs who spend 5 minutes watching the pit eventually notice a gnomish hand poke above the surface. A rope can be used to fish the corpse out of the roiling sand. Strapped to the gnome's waist is a {@item +1 shortsword} with the name "Howler" engraved into its pommel. Tucked into her shirt pocket is a flask filled with a fig liqueur, and she wears a necklace with a large platinum pendant (worth 50 gp).
A PC who succeeds on a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill History}) check recognizes the pendant as the symbol of the Onyx Sabers, an organized crime group in Onist.

entries.name: Concluding the Adventure
entries: Once the PCs lead the camels from the pool and back to the caravan, a grateful (and perhaps a little surprised) Tasnim shoots them an impressed and appreciative look. Along the way to Onist, the PC with the highest passive {@skill Perception} spies some bandits lurking along the caravan's path, but the presence of armed guards is enough to scare them off without a fight. The PCs and the caravan travel the rest of the way to the city without incident, and when they arrive, Tasnim gladly pays them the agreed-upon amount.

entries.name: Adventure Background
entries: Following his escape from the local magistrate's cells, the bandit Sben Albacht and his gang holed up in the Hundedel family's farmhouse while they wait to escape the area under cover of darkness. The family fled to the nearby village of Vandlewin before the bandits moved in, but in the chaos of their rush to escape, they realized too late that their oldest child, Kristoph, had somehow gotten off their cart and had been left behind. Kristoph is unharmed and is being kept prisoner, under guard, in his bedroom. Sben hopes he can trade the boy's life for his freedom should all other avenues of escape be lost.

entries.name: Adventure Hook
entries: The following hooks start the PCs on this adventure:

items: {@b {@i Harried Rider.}} A traveler on horseback who is pushing the animal to its limits waves down the PCs, then stops, panting. He breathlessly explains that he's from the village of Vandlewin, just a half-day's ride up the road. A group of blackguards broke their leader out of the magistrate's cells and then took some poor farmer's boy hostage and are holed up at the family's farmstead.

{@b {@i Tavern Talk.}} At a tavern in the city the PCs are in, they overhear a merchant talking about the events in Vandlewin. The people he's speaking to aren't capable fighters and are afraid to help. "Shame about that boy, but I'm not messing about with the likes of the Albacht gang," one of them says. The merchant explains that Vandlewin is just about a half-day's ride from here.

entries.name: Hundedel Hostage
entries: Once the PCs arrive in Vandlewin, they are brought to the elderly local magistrate, Milliam Volstacker. When the PCs are brought before him, he says, too loudly, "Adventurers! Thank the gods!" then conveys the following details:

items: After the Albacht Gang freed their leader, Sben Albacht, from the magistrate's cell, the bandits fled on stolen horses toward the Hundedel family's farmhouse located a half-day's ride from town.

Mr. Hundedel was out in the fields when he saw the bandits riding hard in their direction. He recognized Albacht and knew he needed to get his family to safety. He hastily gathered his family into their carriage and rushed to town.

They'd put their oldest child, Kristoph (age 5) inside the carriage and closed him in; Mrs. Hundedel insists that he didn't know how to get the carriage door open. They'd loaded several of their small animals into the cart with him, but he'd been crying because they couldn't find his favorite, Ogyss.

Unbeknownst to the family, the boy ran off when Mr. Hundedel was tethering the horses, and Mrs. Hundedel was getting their baby, Raimeson, ready for the trip. Both mother and father rode outside on the driver's seat, and so in the chaos of their rush to escape the bandits, they didn't notice Kristoph had run off. Mrs. Hundedel thinks the boy must have seen Ogyss and ran after him.

entries: If asked what kind of animals the Hundedels raise, Milliam says, "Oh, I don't know. All kinds, really. They've got some hogs, some chickens and goats. Some kind of lizard, I think." He doesn't know what kind of animal Ogyss is.

If the PCs ask to speak to the Hundedels directly, Milliam says that the parents are extremely distraught, and he would prefer not to question them right now—and time is of the essence. If the PCs insist, a DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check convinces him to allow it. The parents don't have any additional information relevant to the matter, but they can tell the PCs that Ogyss is a {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3}, a kind of friendly draconic creature the size of a house cat.

entries.name: Complication
entries: If the PCs need any convincing, Milliam notes that four members of the town watch were killed during Sben's escape, so he doesn't trust the remaining members of the watch to get the job done without getting the boy killed.

entries.name: Reward
entries: Milliam offers to pay the PCs: (1) 100 gp for the rescue of Kristoph Hundedel; (2) 50 gp for each bandit captured or killed; and (3) for Albacht himself, 100 gp if killed or 500 gp if the notorious bandit is recaptured so that he can be properly tried.

entries.name: Razorback Crab Burrow
entries: If the PCs spend an hour exploring the area around the Hundedel family farm they can find an access to the burrow of the {@creature razorback crab|ToB3|razorback crabs} by making a DC 16 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. Access points can be found up to a half-mile from the farm. If the PCs attempt to travel through the burrow, they can reach the southernmost portion of the {@creature razorback crab|ToB3} burrow within 10 minutes by making a successful DC 13 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) or Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) check.
The pungent scent of ammonia, fainter in the tunnels and sharper in the chambers, fills the burrow. Scuttling can be heard to the northeast.

entries.name: Ceilings
entries: The burrow's tunnels are 5 feet high, forcing Medium creatures to crouch to move through them.

entries.name: Lighting
entries: The burrow is dark and has no natural light sources.

entries.name: Smell
entries: The burrow smells of ammonia from the crabs' excretions. Upon entry, a creature must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or suffer from the {@condition poisoned} condition while within the burrow. A {@condition poisoned} creature can attempt a new saving throw every minute; a successful save ends the effect. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw cannot be affected by the burrow again until 24 hours have passed.

entries.name: Sound
entries: The crabs can be heard burrowing to the north. Their hard carapaces make a dull scratching sound as they scrape against the walls.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: For every 10 minutes the PCs spend in the burrow, roll {@condition 1d6} and consult the Razorback Crab Burrow table. Adult {@creature razorback crab|ToB3|razorback crabs} are aggressive and defend the burrow to the death.

entries.caption: Razorback Crab Burrow
rows: {@dice 2d10} harmless Tiny {@creature juvenile razorback crab|ToB3-Lairs|juvenile razorback crabs}. (Juvenile crabs have AC 14, 1 hit point, and can take no actions.)

entries: If the PCs reach {@area 11|3.11|u} before the {@creature razorback crab|ToB3|razorback crabs} finish burrowing into the farmhouse, they can complete the tunnel—and thus burrow into the farmhouse—in {@dice 1d6} minutes. If they do not have proper tools, they can use the severed scoop-claw limbs of the crabs to do so.

The PC doing the digging must make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check (with disadvantage if using the razorback claw as their tool); if they surpass a DC equal to 10 + the number of minutes rolled on the d6 above, the bandits assume that the scratching is coming from the farm's {@creature shovel dragonette|ToB3|shovel dragonettes} and thus are surprised when the PCs burst into {@area 1|3.1|u}. If the {@dice d20} roll is a 1 on the Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, the digging PC suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entries.name: Hundedel Farmyard
entries: {@note An unlabelled version of the map can be found {@link here|https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TheGiddyLimit/homebrew/master/_img/ToB3-Lairs/map/3.jpg}.}

The low grass of the farmyard is worn to bare dirt paths leading from the farmhouse to the pastures and outbuildings. Figures can occasionally be seen moving furtively near the fenced perimeter and inside the farmhouse itself.

The farmyard is neatly bordered by a wide-slat wooden fence which has an ungated 30-foot-wide entryway to the south. All of the fences are 5 feet tall and can be vaulted during a creature's movement with a successful DC 12 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Twelve {@creature bandit||bandits} have been posted in the yard to keep watch. They have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks against attempts to approach the farm from the south, east, or west. The tall grass to the north of the farm makes the area lightly obscured. The bandits use the fence and buildings for cover as best as possible and try to stay out of sight of observers.

entries.name: 1. Hundedel Great Room

entries: This large room serves as kitchen, dining area, and recreation room. A large bearskin sits next to the wood-burning stove on the northern wall, and a prep table can be found to the east. A worn but solid wooden table with sturdy chairs occupies much of the room's center, and dirty dishes litter its surface. The floor is covered with muddy footprints, both from boots and what looks like some sort of reptile.

Sben's gang have made themselves at home here. The sound of digging is audible in this room; the gang ignores it, thinking it's the farm's dragonettes. The digging is actually being done by a colony of {@creature razorback crab|ToB3|razorback crabs} that has been burrowing beneath the farmhouse for weeks. (See the "{@area Razorback Crab Burrow|3.rcb|x}" section.)

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Sben (NE {@creature bandit captain}) and five {@creature bandit||bandits} occupy this room. The {@creature bandit||bandits} are not actively watching for intruders and will parley if they are not immediately attacked.

entries.name: Developments
entries: If combat ensues, once two or more of the {@creature bandit||bandits} are defeated, Sben flees to {@area 2|3.2|u}; once inside, he knocks over the wardrobe inside to block the door (requiring a DC 15 Strength {@skill Athletics}] check to break through). After he flees, any remaining {@creature bandit||bandits} surrender if injured; if not under guarded or tied up, any {@creature bandit||bandits} that surrender will attempt to run at the most opportune moment.

At the beginning of the second or third round of combat—or after the PCs have been parleying with the {@creature bandit||bandits} for a minute or more—four {@creature razorback crab|ToB3|razorback crabs} burst into the room from below. The crabs immediately attack the closest humanoid to them.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Mrs. Hundedel's mandolin was gifted to her by a master luthier and is worth 200 gp. The muddy grizzly bearskin on the floor near the fireplace, if cleaned up, is worth 75 gp.

entries.name: 2. Mr. and Mrs. Hundedel's Room

entries: This once tidy room is now tracked with muddy boot prints. The room has obviously been ransacked for valuables. The wardrobe has been opened and rifled through. All of the common woolen clothes that once hung within it now in a heap on the floor. On the bed is a bloody, brutally injured woman who writhes in pain.

On the bed is Sben's sister, Marcella Albacht (N {@creature bandit captain}, with only 1 hit point remaining), who was injured by the {@creature boar} in {@area 5|3.5|u}. She only moves from the bed if forced. Under her body, the bedding is a muddy, bloody mess.

entries.name: Development
entries: If Sben flees into this room, after using the wardrobe to block the door he then exits the farmhouse through the window and heads north into the tall grass where he attempts to hide until nightfall.
Sben trusts the good nature of the local villagers and would sooner leave his sister so she can recover rather than risk her life—and his capture—by taking her with him.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: An ornately carved wooden case with silver hinges sits on a small table by the bed (worth 15 gp). Inside is a {@item silvered dagger|phb} with a mother of pearl hilt (worth 75 gp).

entries.name: 3. Kristoph Hundedel's Room

entries: Finely crafted wooden toys are scattered in a chaotic jumble around the floor of this room. On the floor, beside the unmade bed, is a plate of half-eaten food. Sitting on top of the bed is a young boy whose eyes light up with hope upon seeing you. As you enter, leaping to his feet from a chair next to the bed is a black-haired ruffian.
Kristoph is being held hostage in his bedroom by the ruffian, Yosuf. The toys littering the floor, make the room difficult terrain.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: In this room are Yosuf (NE {@creature bandit}), plus one {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3} that is hiding under the bed; this dragonette is Ogyss, which Kristoph left the carriage to chase after.

entries.name: Development
entries: Yosuf has been feeding the {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3} from the plate of food on the floor, so if the PCs attack him, the dragonette emerges from beneath the bed and strikes at them; if that happens, Kristoph shouts {@i "Oggie, no!"} at the creature.

If he's not surprised, Yosuf attempts to grapple Kristoph on his first turn, then pulls a {@item dagger|phb} and threatens to kill the boy. If attacked, he shoves Kristoph at his attacker and attempts to escape. If two or more PCs enter the room, the {@creature bandit} surrenders with a successful DC 13 Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check; if only one PC enters, he fights.

Jars of pickles and preserves have been knocked off the shelves and onto the floor of this pantry, soaking the bags of barley, potatoes, and carrots below in fruit and pickling brine. A few hams, links of smoked sausages, and sacks of onions hang from hooks on the ceiling. It looks like there was enough food in the pantry to carry the Hundedel family through the coming winter, but the bandits' depredations have reduced their stores considerably.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: A {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3} is greedily eating pickled asparagus and cherries off the floor. If the door is opened, it uses its breath weapon to drive the interlopers away and then returns to its meal. If further disturbed, it becomes angry and attacks. If reduced to 10 hit points, the dragonette disengages and attempts to escape the farmhouse to lick its wounds behind the barn at {@area 6|3.6|u}.

entries.name: 5. Pigsty

entries: Wide, horizontal planks of wood fence in a pig sty. Filthy straw is scattered across the muddy ground and an empty trough runs the length of the sty's northern border. A door in the eastern barrier leads into the pigs' stall in the barn.
A sow and a {@creature boar} pace the sty in agitation. Sben's gang gives the boar a wide berth since it gored Marcella and their leader ordered them to leave the beast alone.

entries.name: Development
entries: The {@creature boar} can be freed with a successful DC 13 Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check, provided no creature enters the sty. The {@creature boar} can't be commanded, but the successful check prevents it from attacking the PCs or their companions as it rages through the farmyard. The freed {@creature boar} roams the farm looking for food and luxuriating in its freedom; it attacks any {@creature bandit||bandits} it encounters on its way toward the farm gate in the south fence.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Marcella's gold and ivory cameo locket (worth 45 gp) was torn from its chain and trampled into the mud when she was attacked by the {@creature boar}. A creature with a passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score of 14 or higher notices the sun reflecting off an exposed piece of the jewelry.

entries.name: 6. Barn

entries: This small barn smells of soil and hay. Clean straw is heaped in the two horse stables and the interior pigsty along the northern portion of the structure, and stacked bales are piled neatly along the west wall. A variety of farm tools hang tidily from hooks and brackets on the south wall, and an empty barrow rests in the northwest corner. The sound of snoring can be heard from a stall to the northeast.

The exterior of the barn has recently been painted a bright red. The bandits have mostly avoided the dirt-floored building, due to the excitable {@creature shovel dragonette|ToB3|shovel} and {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3|barnyard dragonettes} lairing in it.

entries.name: Development
entries: If the PCs make it to the barn without drawing attention to themselves, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1-4, two of the {@creature bandit||bandits}, Kel and Sora, are quietly mid-tryst in the center stable.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Two {@creature shovel dragonette|ToB3|shovel dragonettes} and one {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3} are napping in the stall to the northeast. If they are awoken by the PCs, they excitedly yip and jump at their ankles, trying to initiate play. If this occurs, any {@creature bandit||bandits} on watch near the barn investigate within 3 rounds. If the PCs misconstrue the dragonettes' playfulness as aggression, they will defend themselves; if any of them are killed or knocked {@condition unconscious}, the remaining dragonettes will attempt to flee, making a lot of noise in the process.
A large wooden pail hangs from the well's free-spinning crossbeam. It can be lowered and raised using the attached hand crank.

entries.name: Development
entries: Father Hundedel has long been terrified that Kristoph might tumble down the well. Thus, he has secured rungs on the southern shaft of the well that allow one to easily climb up or down the 80-foot shaft. From above, a successful DC 12 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check is required to notice them. Creatures at the bottom of the well have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks when attempting to hide from being seen from ground level.

entries.name: 8. Chicken Coop

entries: A stout post at each corner suspends the floor of the chicken coop. An occasional cluck can be heard from one of the hens roosting inside.

Inside, dirty straw litters the floor, while the straw filling the nesting beds is clean; twenty-four chickens amble about, some of them taking umbrage at the intrusion. The {@creature bandit||bandits} ignore noise from the coop, as any loud sound sends the hens clucking loudly, but they investigate if any of them escape. Like the barn, the coop has recently been painted bright red.

entries.name: 9. Horse Paddock

entries: The gate to this paddock is open. Mounds of soil mar the pasture, indicating the presence of some small burrowing creature.

The paddock is empty as the Hundedels took their horses when they escaped the farm. There's loose soil in one corner that indicates a very small creature had been digging here; a shovel dragonette burrowed down here and emerged into {@area 13|3.13|u}.

entries.name: Development
entries: If the PCs have the equipment, they can expand the dragonette's tunnel wide enough to squeeze through to {@area 13|3.13|u} with 30 minutes of work.

entries.name: 10. Sheep and Goat Pen

entries: Bleating ewes and lambs graze alongside stammering nanny goats and their rambunctious kids.

The grass here is kept short by the twenty sheep and sixteen {@creature goat||goats} grazing in it. While an observer can see clearly through the pen fence from one side of it to the other, the beasts within provide cover from view.
The corpse of Nitti, the Hundedels' collie, has been left unceremoniously by the bandits just outside of the fence to the northeast.

entries.name: Development
entries: The PCs can move undetected through the animal enclosure with a DC 10 Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) or Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check.

The {@creature barnyard dragonette|ToB3|barnyard dragonettes} from {@area 6|3.6|u} venture out to this pen at sunup and sundown every day to check on the livestock. If they notice unfamiliar humanoids in the pen, they excitedly speak to the sheep or goats (via {@spell speak with animals}) to find out what is going on. If this happens, any checks made to move through the pasture without being noticed are made with disadvantage.
{@dice 1d4} {@creature bandit||bandits} located in the farmyard investigate within 6 rounds if any of the sheep or goats escape the pen.

entries.name: 11. Farmhouse Tunnel

entries: A mild but unpleasant odor of ammonia lingers in this low, recently dug tunnel.
As noted in {@area 1|3.1|u}, {@creature razorback crab|ToB3|razorback crabs} are tunneling into the Hundedel farmhouse from here.
The walls of this rough-hewn cave are stacked with roe-like crab eggs. The odor of ammonia is almost overpowering.

entries.name: Creatures
entries: Three {@creature razorback crab|ToB3|razorback crabs} defend the nursery, moving to intercept and dispatch any threats to the eggs. They fight to the death.

entries.name: 13. Food Storage

entries: The smell of ammonia is strong in here. Piles of unidentifiable organic matter are moldering next to stalks of pale gray fungus. A dead shovel dragonette lays atop one of the piles.

A PC that makes a DC 13 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check can determine from the soil scattered among the piles and the state of the chamber's ceiling that the dragonette must have burrowed in from above.

entries.name: Development
entries: If the PCs have the equipment, they can expand the dragonette's tunnel wide enough to squeeze through to {@area 9|3.9|u} with 30 minutes of work.

entries.name: 14. Sleep Niche

entries: Hundreds of dormant young razorback crabs are resting on the many earthen shelves of this nook. The smell of ammonia is stronger here than anywhere else in the burrow.

If the PCs enter this area with a light source, the {@creature juvenile razorback crab|ToB3-Lairs|juvenile crabs} wake and tumble off the shelves toward {@area 12|3.12|u} like a wave. Any PC in the niche or the tunnel leading to {@area 12|3.12|u} must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} by the odor (and revolted by the sensation of scuttling legs) for 1 minute.

entries.name: Development
entries: When the PCs arrive in this area, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a result of 1 or 2, there is one {@creature razorback crab|ToB3} watching the niche. The crab fights to the death to allow the {@creature juvenile razorback crab|ToB3-Lairs|juveniles} to escape to {@area 12|3.12|u}.

entries.name: Concluding the Adventure
entries: If the PCs rescue Kristoph Hundedel, his family gladly gifts them with the mandolin in {@area 1|3.1|u} and the {@item silvered dagger|phb|dagger} in {@area 2|3.2|u}. Likewise, the magistrate gladly pays the agreed upon reward, and afterward the townsfolk insist on throwing the PCs a big celebratory feast. Any bandits the PCs didn't kill are successfully captured and arrested.

rows: {@b An adventure for four to five characters of 2nd level}

entries.name: Adventure Background
entries: Finlay Barrett was a notorious pirate and smuggler who sails the seas in his ship, the {@i Dead Reckoning}. Barrett was an old salt, but even the most seasoned sailor runs afoul of nature. The {@i Dead Reckoning} was wrecked during a terrible storm, and part of the ship and its cargo are now washed ashore in Lonely Cove, an isolated strip of beach at the base of towering sandstone cliffs. Word spreads quickly about the wreck. Ambitious souls move quickly to gather what they can of whatever valuables Barrett was carrying. Time is of the essence, because the next high tide or storm could carry away any treasures currently in Lonely Cove.

entries.name: Adventure Hook
entries: The following can be used to start the PCs on this adventure:

items: {@b {@i Chance Encounter.}} The PCs are aboard a passing ship and spy the wreckage. They convince the captain to drop anchor so they can row ashore and investigate, or perhaps the captain commissions them to do so, in order for the ship to claim salvage rights.

{@b {@i Rumor Has It.}} A survivor of the {@i Dead Reckoning} was brought into port aboard a naval cutter. Rumors are flying around town about the wreck and the possibility that Finlay Barrett's treasure is out there for the taking.
